{{incomplete|section|date=February 2011}}<!--no mention of the state of protests, there were at least SOME people in Tahrir-->
Finance Minister Samir Radwan said 6.5 billion [[Egyptian pounds]] (US$960 million) will be allocated to cover a 15 percent raise in pensions and salaries for government employees. This decision was made at the first Cabinet meeting since the protests began. One protester said that protests would not end soon because of increasing concessions that the regime offers.<ref>[http://apnews.myway.com//article/20110207/D9L7VGTG1.html Egypt approves 15 percent raise for govt employees]</ref>
Finance Minister Samir Radwan said 6.5 billion [[Egyptian pounds]] (US$960 million) will be allocated to cover a 15 percent raise in pensions and salaries for government employees. This decision was made at the first Cabinet meeting since the protests began. One protester said that protests would not end soon because of increasing concessions that the regime offers.<ref>[http://apnews.myway.com//article/20110207/D9L7VGTG1.html Egypt approves 15 percent raise for govt employees]</ref>
